column4: My computer's tellin me that im receiving data at about 80 kb/s without any thing open.. any ideas?
maybe isntall iftop and see whats going on? ..
bash: isntall: command not found
aptitude install iftop ?
either way, how do i figure out whats downloading all this data... its runnin up my cpu usage
k i got iftop but I still get bash: 'isntall: command not found'
sudo iftop
alright, it seems to be coming from fa.46.1343.static.theplan
I have no idea what that is
there is a port settings option in iftop. press h.
ah thank you very much
np. now you get to learn iptables drop commands. :)
w00t, back down to 0 kb/s =D
get it blocked than?
Well, It was a custom conky script that executes every minute and displays all the current users on a forum I goto, So I just removed the script entirely
outbound spam. nice.
I'm sure the forums admins appreciated it, too =p
lol
you guys dont get paid enough for this =p
I learned something from that export command. it's all good.
Yeah? I learned to properly exit my code so its not piling up dozens of http requests haha
